author: Haight, Canniff.

title: Great Britain, France and Belgium: a short tour in 1835
author: Humphrey, Heman
snippet: I was indebted to Dr. Beilby, one of the proprietors, and a physician of high standing, for an hour's walk in these Elysian Fields, as well as for many other civilities, during my short stay in Edinburgh. The New Town, since the original plan was formed, has been very much extended, particularly to the north, where you grow weary in admiring the Royal Crescent, Royal Circus, Drummond Place, Moray Place, and many other superb blocks of private dwellings. Whether the New Town of Edinburgh has any " rival in Europe or in the world," I cannot tell.
